questions.question_text: A business customer deploys workloads in the public cloud. Now the customer network faces governance issues with the flow of IT traffic and must ensure the security of data and intellectual property. Which action helps to identify the issue for further resolution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This is another trick question. Generally answer should be A as this is lowest cost if it is greenfield deployment. The argument of security doesn't stack up because the Public clouds these days have most security certifications. However, because the deployment in question is an existing one, suggests Hybrid cloud is the correct answer. The workloads can run on-premise and public cloud used only for bursting.

Selected Answer: A
I think is A.

Public clouds provide low-cost, scalable resources that help reduce capital expenditures (CAPEX). Because the cloud provider manages the infrastructure, there is no need to purchase equipment or hardware, optimizing operational costs (OPEX). Resources can also be quickly scaled up or down to improve performance and workload flexibility.

Selected Answer: A
The public cloud: provides the scalability, flexibility, and cost-efficiency required for the hospital to respond to changing demands while keeping costs low. Security concerns can be addressed with robust cloud security practices and compliance with healthcare regulations like GDPR and HIPAA.

Selected Answer: B
Various levels of security then Hybrid is a good option
Private is more expensive and it is for high security
Public only is no a good option for confidential information

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer as it is a hospital with various levels of systems security.

Selected Answer: A
A.
Lowest cost option is public cloud. Hybrid has high cost and still requires CapEX.
